page.title: 14MARINE ECOLOGY SURVEY 1985
page.content:
Ecological studies were carried out on two beaches in Flushing, Little Falmouth Beach and Kiln Beach. The amount of life on each beach was compared at low tide.Brown seaweeds (especially Bladder Wrack) were found to be commonest on both beaches with only small amounts of red or green. Little Falmouth Beach had more animal life present,being a muddy shore with large rocks.Kiln Beach was sandier. The commonest animals on both beaches were sandhoppers: approx.135 found on 25 sq.metres on Little Falmouth Beach and 65 on Kiln Beach. { Pollution: There was little pollution except for broken glass and litter. There was more litter on Kiln Beach compared to Little Falmouth Beach.
{ } { }
